example.text: Since RTKs are initiating signaling by recruiting downstream components to the activated receptor, proteins that are immediately downstream of an activated RTK can be identified by first identifying sequences in the RTK that are necessary to activate downstream signaling (Schlessinger and Ullrich, 1992; Pawson, 1995).

example.text: Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs (2.1-2.7 kb in Burkitt lines), being initiated within intron 1.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs (2.1-2.7 kb in Burkitt lines), which can be initiated within intron 1.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs (2.1-2.7 kb in Burkitt lines), which is able to be initiated within intron 1.

signal transduction can be initiated by SCF by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit,and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo tyrosine autophosphorylation (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which initiated downstream intracellular signaling.
example.arg: by direct dimerization of its receptor
